issue.title: [C++] Add machine benchmarks
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-4079](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4079). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
I wonder if it may be useful to add machine benchmarks. I have a cache/memory latency benchmark lying around, we could also add e.g. memory bandwidth benchmarks.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4079?focusedCommentId=16725093) by Uwe Korn (uwe):*
These tests just test out the general performance of the system and are not Arrow specific? That would still be a nice addition as it can be used as a good baseline for comparing benchmark numbers between two systems.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4079?focusedCommentId=16725095) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Right, that's the idea. Those are generally also available through third-party software, but you have to find and install it :-)

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4079?focusedCommentId=16725096) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
I'm in favor of having machine benchmarks. 

If we start building a nightly benchmark database (I think we should at some point) then having the machine benchmarks would be useful to see if there are changes due to e.g. kernel updates

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4079?focusedCommentId=16726182) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
